items.title: Official Shure holiday sale now live: Some of the best podcast mics out there now up to $50 off
items.summary:
Shure’s USB and XLR mics are some of the best and most popular in the podcast space, and its official holiday deals are going live this morning. While some of these models, many of which are the same mics you see being used on the podcasts you watch everyday, have seen some official price hikes over the last number of months, price drops are relatively rare and the holiday deals are now live on both the latest releases and some of the most popular options in the lineup. All of the deals are waiting on this page, but you’ll find a detailed breakdown of the offers down below. 

more…

items.title: Giant $900 discount drops Razer’s 2025 Blade 14 3K OLED gaming laptop with RTX 5070 down to its lowest price
items.summary:
We are now tracking a deal at Amazon that drops Razer’s 2025 Blade 14 gaming laptop with RTX 5070 GPU for $1,799.99 shipped. This particular model typically goes for $2,700 directly at Razer, and it’s now seeing a massive $900 discount. We saw this unit drop down to $1,900 last month, but today’s offer lands it $100 below that to mark a new best price to beat. Another variant of this laptop with an RTX 5060 graphics card is also discounted to $1,699.99 shipped, down from its usual price of $2,300. Head below for more details.

more…

items.title: Samsung’s new $1,000 ‘world’s first 500Hz OLED’ Odyssey gaming monitor just hit a new all-time low at $610
items.summary:
As part of its updated Samsung monitor sale, Woot is offering the brand’s latest 27-inch Odyssey G6 (G60SF) 500Hz OLED gaming monitor for $609.99 Prime shipped (a $6 delivery fee will apply otherwise). This particular model hit the scene a few months back as the ‘world’s first 500Hz OLED’ gaming display carrying a $1,000 price tag. It’s rarely seen any notable discounts since then, but today’s Woot deal changes that with a massive $390 price drop. This is the lowest price we have tracked for this monitor to date, and the same monitor, in case you’re wondering, is currently fetching $800 and $900 directly at Samsung and Amazon, respectively. Head below for more details.

items.title: The full Babbel language library is available now at an exclusive price
items.summary:
Learning a new language isn’t easy, but some apps might be making it harder than it needs to be. If you’re done with rote memorization exercises and long, boring grammar lessons, try Babbel. Babbel makes consistency easy with short lessons you can complete in minutes, and you can get a lifetime subscription for $134.99 with code LEARN (reg. $299).
